p: Human migration and travel have played a pivotal role in infectious disease emergence for centuries. For example, the arrival of smallpox in the New World with European colonization led to mass fatalities among the indigenous population who had never encountered such diseases before [ 99]. In the 21st century a large outbreak of Middle Eastern respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV) was reported in Korea. The outbreak is believed to have started with a single traveler who had recently returned from a business trip to multiple Middle Eastern countries [ 100].
